A writer from Canada wrote the book. His name is Yann Martel. This was his third book. It came out in 2001.

Martel's father had an important job for his country. So, when Martel was a child, he lived in many places. He lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.

FAIL: CEFR Compliance. While the classifier returned 'A2', a manual audit reveals B1-level sentence complexity.

- Structural Violation: The sentence 'So, when Martel was a child, he lived in many places' uses a subordinate time clause ('when Martel was a child'). This is a B1 grammatical structure and is not permitted at the A2 level. A2 texts must use simple and compound sentences connected only by 'and', 'but', 'so', or 'because'.

- Metric Warning: The MeaningBERT score of 0.7437 is below the strict 0.75 threshold. This indicates a minor but detectable loss of the original text's nuance. The simplification was slightly too aggressive.

- Suggestion: Deconstruct the complex sentence into two simple sentences. Remove the 'when' clause. Example: 'Martel's father had this job. So, Martel lived in many places as a child.'
